item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Here's what I think, Mr. Wind-Up Bird," said May Kasahara. "Everybody's born with some different thing at the core of their existence. And that thing, whatever it is, becomes like a heat source that runs each person from the inside. I have one too, of course. Like everybody else. But sometimes it gets out of hand. It swells or shrinks inside me, and it shakes me up. What I'd really like to do is find a way to communicate that feeling to another person. But I can't seem to do it. They just don't get it. Of course, the problem could be that I'm not explaining it very well, but I think it's because they're not listening very well. They pretend to be listening, but they're not, really. So I get worked up sometimes, and I do some crazy things." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "We've had some fun tonight...considering we're all gonna <i>die</i> someday." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Kugemnstr add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Boy, those French! They have a different word for everything." -- Steve Martin
